single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and each across 47 your goal length is anywhere from 11-12 we will now begin working in rounds round 2 will be worked in both sides of the single crochets you just made you will work your front apron in the front loops and your back apron will be worked in the back loops i have added a picture of round 2 after the turn to show where to work the rest of the stitches this is found at the end of the pattern round 2 turn chain 1 *double_crochet in flo of nxt 11 double_crochet in both loops of nxt* repeat *to* 2x more double_crochet in flo of nxt 11 turn double_crochet in flo of nxt 11 *slip_stitch in nxt double_crochet double_crochet in flo of nxt 11* repeat *to* 2x more slip_stitch to 1st double_crochet to join round 3 chain 1 working in both loops for this round double_crochet in same st as join and nxt 10 *double_crochet in slip_stitch double_crochet in nxt 11* repeat *to* 2x more *double_crochet in nxt 11 slip_stitch in nxt double_crochet* repeat *to* 2x more double_crochet in nxt 11 join with slip_stitch to 1st double_crochet round 4-6 repeat round 3 round 7 chain 1 slip_stitch in nxt 10 sts *skip slip_stitch slip_stitch in nxt 11 double_crochet* repeat *to* 2x more single_crochet in nxt 11 double_crochet *single_crochet in slip_stitch single_crochet in nxt 11 double_crochet* repeat *to* 2x more join with slip_stitch to 1st slip_stitch your first row of seamless egg pouches have been made repeat rounds 2-7 once more you will end up with 2 row of 4 pouches we will now go back to working in row row 13 turn chain 1 hdc2tog half_double_crochet across to last 2 hdc2tog 45 row 14 repeat row 13 43 row 15 repeat row 13 41 row 16 repeat row 13 39 if you plan on using a ribbon for your tie continue to row 17 if you d like to make a crochet tie skip to optional crochet tie ending row row 17 slip_stitch down the side angle to the top of the pocket turn chain 1 single_crochet in the sl sts you just made and in each st across the top then down the angle on the side slip_stitch to top of the pocket to join weave in ends cut a piece of ribbon about 3 ft long weave this in and out of the last row of hdcs i like to tie a little knot at the edge of the apron so the top doesn t cinch and boink your eggs around optional
